title: Verify Prometheus metrics are written to an endpoint

blocks.title: Verify Prometheus metrics are written to an endpoint

blocks.content:
While installing and configuring Prometheus in your local environment is out of scope for this journey, a good first step in this journey is to verify that your system is writing metrics to the Prometheus endpoint.

To verify Prometheus metrics are written to an endpoint:
Log into the machine on which Prometheus is installed.
If required, switch to a user that has administrative privileges.

To check the Prometheus service status, run one of the following commands:

For Linux:

```
systemctl status prometheus.service
```

For Windows:

```
sc query prometheus
```

You should see something similar to the following:

blocks.alt: Picture that shows the Prometheus service up and running

blocks.content:
To ensure that Prometheus is capturing the metrics, open a browser tab and navigate to the metrics endpoint URL.

For example, navigate to `http://localhost:9090/metrics`

You should see something similar to the following:

blocks.alt: Picture that shows metrics in a browser tab

blocks.content: **Tip:** Consult the Prometheus documentation if you are unable to run the Prometheus service or can't verify that Prometheus is capturing metrics.
